results.question: What led to lower capital expenditures at Bell Media in 2019?
gold_answer: production equipment and IT upgrades in 2018
results.markdown_table_response: Our goal in 2018 was to raise capital to increase our wireless network capacity, extend coverage and improve network speeds. We did not realize the results we were achieving until we got a call from Bell to tell us they were readying to invest in the wireless segment, given the significant growth in their other wireless segments.
results.csv_string_response: Capital spending at Bell Media in 2019 decreased by 0.3 pts compared to the year prior, but we were still able to generate $2.9 billion in capital spending. This was due to our continued investments in our LTE-A network, our investments in our wireless segment of $33 million in 2019, and our continued focus on future growth.
results.json_rows_response:
Bell Media's capital spending was lower in 2019 than it was in 2018. The cause was the following:
• Greater investments in our wireless segment of $33 million in 2019, compared to 2018, as we advanced the build-out of our LTE-A network, continued to deploy wireless small-cells to expand capacity to support subscriber growth and increase network speeds, coverage and signal quality, as well as to expand data fibre backhaul in preparation for 5G technology
• A modest reduction in capital spending in our wireline segment of $10 million in 2019, compared to last year, as we continued to focus our investments on the ongoing deployment of FTTP to more homes and businesses, the roll-out of fixed WTTP to rural locations in Ontario and Québec, the connection of fibre Internet and TV services to more homes and businesses and the execution of business customer contracts
• Lower capital expenditures at Bell Media in our international segment of $12 million in 2019, compared to last year, mainly due to production equipment and IT upgrades in 2018

• A modest reduction in capital spending in our wireline segment of $10 million in 2019, compared to last year, as we continued to focus our investments on the ongoing deployment of FTTP to more homes and businesses, the roll-out of fixed WTTP to rural locations in Ontario and Québec, the connection of fibre Internet and TV services to more homes and businesses and the execution of business customer contracts
• Lower capital expenditures at Bell Media in our wireless segment of $6 million in 2019, compared to last year, mainly due to production equipment and IT upgrades in 2018
